    def test_network_setup_create_network_invalid_integer_fields_invalid_string_length_and_pattern(
        self, network_setup, venue_setup_e2e, platform_admin_access_token, platform_admin_org_id,
        key, subkey, value, expected_status_code, expected_response_body
    ):
        """
        Test network_setup create network failure (invalid integer fields, invalid length or pattern of string fields)
        """
    
        # make sure login was successful
        network_setup.access_token = platform_admin_access_token
        assert network_setup.access_token is not None
    
        # create a valid venue under org and get it's venueId
        response = venue_setup_e2e.create_venue(admin_access_token=platform_admin_access_token, org_id=platform_admin_org_id)
    
        venue_id = response.json()["venueId"]
    
        # take a valid payload
        payload = {
            "networkName": constants.VALID_SSID,
            "networkTypeId": NETWORK_TYPES[0]["networkTypeId"],
            "configuration": {
                "name": constants.VALID_SSID,
                "description": constants.VALID_DESCRIPTION,
                "password": constants.VALID_PASSWORD,
                "vlan": constants.VALID_VLAN_ID,
                "downStream": constants.VALID_DOWNSTREAM,
                "upStream": constants.VALID_UPSTREAM,
                "clientIsolation": False
            },
            "venueId": [
                venue_id
            ],
            "orgId": platform_admin_org_id
        }
    
        # override some attr value with test case specific value
        if subkey is None:
            payload[key] = value
        else:
            payload[key][subkey] = value
    
        response = network_setup.create_network(payload=payload)
    
>       assert check_response(
            response, expected_status_code=expected_status_code, expected_content_type="JSON",
            expected_response_body=expected_response_body
        )
